Non-stop Learning!

It has been quite a while since the last blog update ><

It has been a very eye-opening experience these few months at work and in school as I get exposed to different aspects of the IT industry. This period has been a non-stop learning period for me as I get my hands on servers, workstations, switches, routers and managing IT end-users who have no idea about IT (i.e. patience-training).

Because of work, I am also keen on taking the Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certificate in order to perform better at work and understand IT networks better.

In school, I am learning the module CS1010X in NUS. Although I have some programming experience, this module was really quite tough as the Professor was quite evil (haha) and I had to balance working and studying at the same time. Fortunately, the module spans 6 months which gives me enough time to catch-up during the weekends.
